Articles.Content:
after loading my career saved game, the parts of my saved rockets dont fit correctly it seems as though the rockets engines are smaller then usual and have the staging decoupler covers dont cover the entire section leaving horizontal gaps in between the engines and the other parts. also the fairings have major gaps as though they are smaller then they used to be. see picture below

the rocket also seems to be very unstabe compaired to the original build and flight.

no mods except mechjeb however it was present before the mechjeb install

Please read this and do all the stuff written there: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

I have a guess what happened to you but without the logs I can't confirm it.

That doesn't look like a stock install, and there's not only Mechjeb involved...

You are definitely using parts from other mods, from mods that had their parts scaled in a way that's different now in 0.25.

EDIT:

By the way, the links do only show up if you have spaces in between them.

http://tinypic.com/r/6tcvwl/8

http://tinypic.com/r/pyjyo/8

http://tinypic.com/view.php?pic=sxyloy&s=8#.VDn_UXucuUk

Stock? I don't think so...

EDIT2:

Let me guess, KW Rocketry?

Solution for KW Rocketry parts

Wait for a 0.25 version or go ahead and multiply (or set if not already there) scale inside MODEL by 1.25 for all parts that have no rescaleFactor set.

Or if you want to do it properly:

For all parts without rescaleFactor, but with any number for scale inside MODEL:

  • Multiply scale inside MODEL by 1.5625 and set rescaleFactor 1 and multiply scale outside MODEL by 1.25.

For parts without scale inside MODEL and no rescaleFactor:

  • Set scale inside MODEL to 1.5625 on each axis and set rescaleFactor 1 and multiply scale by 1.25.

Edited October 12, 2014 by slumpie
